question: Which country houses the deadly active stratovolcano "Mount Sinabung"?
explanation: Indonesia houses the deadly active stratovolcano "Mount Sinabung". Mount Sinabung is a Pleistocene-to-Holocene stratovolcano of andesite and dacite in the Karo plateau of North Sumatra, Indonesia, 40 kilometres from Lake Toba supervolcano. Many old lava flows are on their flanks and the last known eruption, before recent times, occurred 1200 years before the present, between 740 - 880 CE.
